wikipedia_page.main: George Farrell (born 14 August 1964 in St Albans) is a British bobsledder who competed in the early 1990s. Competing in two Winter Olympics, he earned his best finish of fifth in the four-man event at Lillehammer in 1994.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1992 Winter Olympics
Great Britain at the 1994 Winter Olympics

response: Paul Field (born 24 June 1967) is an English bobsledder who competed in the 1992 and 1994 Winter Olympics.  In 1992 he came seventh in the Men's Four along with teammates Mark Tout, George Farrell and Lenox Paul.  In 1994 he came joint tenth. He is also well known as the 1994 UK Gladiators men's champion, as well as the runner-up in the first International Gladiators competition behind America's Wesley Two Scoops Berry, albeit in controversial circumstances following a severe albeit unintentional tackle by American gladiator Hawk, during the Powerball event in the Grand Final. Because of his successful achievements and all-round good sportsmanship, he is still highly regarded amongst fans of the series, and is known as one of the greatest contenders in the history of Gladiators as a global franchise, especially during its mid '90s heyday.
